question: Which of the following is not a benefit of Inheritance?

options.option: a: Customization and Code Reuse is possible without touching the existing code.
b: Child class can add to the existing functionality of Parent class.
d: If child class is modified, parent class property modifies automatically.

description.D: A child class knows about its parent(s) from its definition, however, parent class has no way out to know which all classes have inherited it.

question: Consider the following code snippet and predict the output.

description.A: m() of A is overridden by B and C
description.B: If we call the method m on an instance x of D, i.e. x.m(), we will get the output 'm of B called' since B is written first in the class definition of 'D'.If we transpose the order of the classes in the class header of D in 'class D(C,B):', we will get the output 'm of C called'

question:
choose the correct option.
1. Complex activities regarding start and accelerate involved in driving a car are moved inside Engine class.
This design is an example of : A
2. Driver should not access the mechanical wheels directly, instead he/she needs to call changeGear method.
This is example of : B
3. Same gearbox can be used for forward or reverse motion is an example of : C

description.option: C : Abstraction is about hiding complexities design level
A : Encapsulation hides direct access to internal information of the object,  thereby protecting object data from accidental changes
B : Polymorphism refers to the ability of an object/method to behave differently in different situations.

question:
Fill in the following blanks. Choose your answers from the options given:
The objects are instantiated in A memory, instance variables of an object are created in B memory and local variables of a method are created in C memory.

description.option: The objects are instantiated in Heap memory
Instance variables of an object are created in Heap memory inside the object
local variables of a method are created in Stack memory
